tool.name: qiime2 phylogeny raxml-rapid-bootstrap
tool.description: Construct a phylogenetic tree with bootstrap supports using RAxML.

param.name: alignment
param.label: alignment: FeatureData[AlignedSequence]
param.help: [required] Aligned sequences to be used for phylogenetic reconstruction.

param.name: seed
param.label: seed: Int
param.help: [optional] Random number seed for the parsimony starting tree. This allows you to reproduce tree results. If not supplied then one will be randomly chosen.

param.name: rapid_bootstrap_seed
param.label: rapid_bootstrap_seed: Int
param.help: [optional] Specify a random seed for rapid bootstrapping. This allows you to reproduce rapid bootstrap results. If not supplied then one will be randomly chosen.

param.name: bootstrap_replicates
param.label: bootstrap_replicates: Int % Range(10, None)
param.help: [default: 100] The number of bootstrap searches to perform.

param.name: n_threads
param.label: n_threads: Int % Range(1, None)
param.help: [default: 1] The number of threads to use for multithreaded processing. Using more than one thread will enable the PTHREADS version of RAxML.

param.name: raxml_version
param.label: raxml_version: Str % Choices('Standard', 'SSE3', 'AVX2')
param.help: [default: 'Standard'] Select a specific CPU optimization of RAxML to use. The SSE3 versions will run approximately 40% faster than the standard version. The AVX2 version will run 10-30% faster than the SSE3 version.

tool.help:
QIIME 2: phylogeny raxml-rapid-bootstrap ======================================== Construct a phylogenetic tree with bootstrap supports using RAxML.
Outputs: -------- :tree.qza: The resulting phylogenetic tree.
|
Description: ------------ Construct a phylogenetic tree with RAxML with the addition of rapid bootstrapping support values. See: https://sco.h-its.org/exelixis/web/software/raxml/
|

citations.citation: @article{cite1, author = {Stamatakis, Alexandros}, doi = {10.1093/bioinformatics/btu033}, journal = {Bioinformatics}, number = {9}, pages = {1312-1313}, title = {RAxML version 8: a tool for phylogenetic analysis and post-analysis of large phylogenies}, url = {http://dx.doi.org/10.1093/bioinformatics/btu033}, volume = {30}, year = {2014} }

@article{cite2, author = {Stamatakis, Alexandros and Hoover, Paul and Rougemont, Jacques}, doi = {10.1080/10635150802429642}, journal = {Systematic Biology}, number = {5}, pages = {758-771}, title = {A Rapid Bootstrap Algorithm for the RAxML Web Servers}, url = {http://dx.doi.org/10.1080/10635150802429642}, volume = {57}, year = {2008} }
